entry.title: What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors HCM: Highlights from SAP Sapphire 2025
entry.content:
Top Takeaways for HR Leaders from SAP Sapphire 2025

SAP Sapphire 2025 delivered a bold message, the future of Human Capital Management (HCM) is intelligent, agile, and AI-powered. With new product launches, strategic pivots, and major updates across analytics, service delivery, and digital adoption, SAP is leading the next evolution of HR transformation.

These innovations draw on SAP‚Äôs unparalleled integration of business data and enterprise-grade AI - helping HR leaders make smarter decisions, deliver better experiences, and connect people strategy to business success like never before.

Discover what‚Äôs next in human capital management and what it means for your team.

Key Innovations in SAP SuccessFactors HCM

1. People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud

Announced during Dan Beck‚Äôs HCM keynote, People Intelligence is SAP's next-generation people analytics platform, now integrated with the SAP Business Data Cloud. This solution unifies people and skills data from SAP SuccessFactors with broader business datasets, turning it into actionable, AI-powered insights for HR and business leaders.

Highlights:

  • Self-service, business-friendly interface

  • Hundreds of HR KPIs and AI-based forecasts

  • Governed, enriched workforce data for decision-making

  • Joule copilot integration for instant answers

People Intelligence shall go General Availability sometime in Q3 2025.
Target audience: EC + Workforce Analytics customers aligning with SAP's analytics stack.

2. Performance and Goals Agent

The new Performance and Goals Agent is designed to supercharge the employee-manager relationship. The Performance and Goals Agent aims to enhance performance management by equipping managers with the information they need to have productive and insightful conversations with their team members. 

 
Functionality:
The agent utilizes data-driven insights to help managers identify areas for improvement, highlight employee strengths, and tailor development plans.

Availability:
While the agent was announced at SAP Sapphire 2025, its general availability is planned for Q4 2025. 

3. WalkMe for SAP SuccessFactors HCM

In collaboration with WalkMe, SAP SuccessFactors now features AI-powered in-app guidance across key workflows like onboarding and time-off requests.

Key capabilities:

  • Click-by-click user journey tracking

  • AI-powered step-by-step support and automation

  • Built-in guides for onboarding, compliance, and training

  • Customizable packages for enterprise-wide digital adoption

Availability: Embedded by default effective 1H 2025, with upgrade options to Platform and Premium WalkMe licenses.

4. SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management

Replacing the legacy ECSC (Employee Central Service Center), this new solution delivers purpose-built, AI-powered HR case management and self-service. This new solution brings AI-based case management and self-service HR capabilities into one unified experience.

Features:

  • Intelligent case routing and prioritization with Joule AI

  • Customized case flows for complex HR scenarios

  • Proactive support and sentiment analysis

  • Seamless integration with Employee Central master data

Availability: SKU is now active. ECSC customers will need reimplementation; migration tools and support are in development.

5. New SAP Business Suite Packages for HCM

To further accelerate transformation, SAP is introducing modular SAP Business Suite Packages for HCM. These are pre-integrated bundles of HR capabilities built on SAP BTP that simplify implementation and reduce time-to-value.

These packages provide integrated solutions across:

  • Core HR

  • Workforce planning and analytics

  • HR service delivery

  • AI and automation

Packages allow HR teams to:

  • Choose capabilities based on current needs
  • Scale and integrate easily over time
  • Leverage the full power of SAP Business AI and analytics

Ideal for CHROs looking for a fast, scalable route to value with deep integration and extensibility.

Key Takeaways for HR Leaders

  • AI that Drives Impact: SAP‚Äôs embedded AI enables HR teams to make decisions faster and with confidence.
  • Smarter, More Engaged Employees: Tools like WalkMe and the Performance Agent create better experiences and improve adoption.
  • Data-Driven Workforce Strategy: People Intelligence empowers leaders to align skills, roles, and resources with business strategy.
  • Faster, Simpler Transformation: SAP‚Äôs modular HCM packages reduce complexity and help teams move quickly from planning to value realization.

Final Thoughts

Your best. Made real. Powered by SAP SuccessFactors.

In an era marked by constant change and workforce uncertainty, SAP‚Äôs latest HCM innovations offer a roadmap for resilient, data-driven HR transformation.

By combining AI, people insights, and enterprise integration, SAP SuccessFactors continues to set the benchmark for modern HCM ‚Äî helping organizations around the world not only keep up, but lead the way forward.

For a complete view of all innovations announced at SAP Sapphire 2025, visit the:
SAP Sapphire 2025 Innovation Guide

SAP Sapphire 2025 continues in:

  • Madrid: May 26‚Äì28

entry.title: Creation of Deep Links in SuccessFactors Suites
entry.content:
üì¢What is Deep Link ?  üì¢ It is a hyperlink that helps the system users / those newly experiencing the system for the first time to navigate to the precise target location of user Information/company Information out of the crowded system details, so you will not be lost. You can place this link anywhere on your company website / Emails / external systems by clicking on it will drive you to the desired location, even in the SuccessFactors home page (tiles/cards) or in the main navigation menu.

üó£üîäWhat does 1H-2025 say on the Deep link for those who opted (PPX UI Experience) - SAP recommend that to configure deep links to cards or categories and stop using legacy block deep links in your system. Currently, only certain block deep links containing block types can be resolved for the latest People Profile.

PP3 UI (Legacy People Profile Experience)

PPX UI (Latest People Profile)

BLOCKS

Categories

Portlets

Summary Cards

 

üë®‚Äçüè´What are all the Data elements that comprise forming complete Deep links? 

1.Domain Name - Name used by the application server, you can make use of this information from the browser URL, (Tip ‚Äì Make use of data before ‚Äú/‚Äù), and it varies by customer and region (https://hcm-eu10-sales.hr.cloud.sap)

2.Deep link Path üõ£ ‚Äì True deep links begin with ‚Äú/sf/‚Äù and deep link paths are the first filter and navigation definition of the data/location, where the user would like to navigate to. Deep link would vary based on the location/destination/sf-module of the data where we need to land the user. Currently, we are exploring the employee profile information, so our Deep link path would be ‚Äúsf/liveprofile‚Äù.

Tip üí° ‚Äì We can‚Äôt define the Deep link path on our own, it was pre-defined by the SAP for the different modules and based on the nature of data where the deep link is supported, please find the link for more Deep Link path on your business requirement SAP Help Portal - Deep Links

3.Parameters ‚Äì After Deep Link path, parameters which help for the fine-granular navigation refinement with the help of data (i.e. Key value pair) which directs the user to the destination page where we are expecting the user to land üõ¨. Also, the parameter values vary based on the nature of the data we are trying to land  üõ¨.

  • CategoryId = personalData , jobData , compensation
  • cardId = personalInfo, jobInfo , oneTimePayment
  • username= John123

 

4.Separators ‚Äì There are different separators based on the nature of the parameters we are trying to separate it, they are ( ‚Äú/‚Äù , ‚Äú&‚Äù , ‚Äú?‚Äù , ‚Äú#‚Äù)

 

  • /  - Character serves as a path separator within the URL, much like it does in standard web URLs. Separates the main deep link path ( /sf/) from the specific action or page you're targeting.

  • ? ‚Äì Act as the separator between the base URL and parameters (To recall parameters please refer to the point no 3)

 

  • & -  Acts as a separator between different parameters or key-value pairs within a URL.

 

  • # - Act as an anchor in the URL, which helps to direct the user to a specific section or element within the page. 

Configured Deeplink :

‚Äì Straight Navigation to Personal Data

 

Further granular navigation to Personal Information Detail Page.

Further, you can flip (or) change the values as per your navigation requirements.

entry.title: Colgate's Journey with SAP BTP: Preserving HR Admin Functionality from SAP HCM to SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Webinar Event Date and Time:   17 July 2025 -   Time: 11:00 EST / 17:00 CET

The Challenge:
When transitioning from on-premises SAP HCM to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, HRIT leaders face a crucial question: How do you preserve the custom-built functionality your business relies on while embracing cloud benefits?

The Solution:
Please Join SAP customer, Colgate, in this SAP partner-led event with Comentec, as they share their practical journey of leveraging SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to not only maintain but also enhance critical HR administrative capabilities during their cloud migration, resulting in reduced implementation time and improved user satisfaction.

In This Webinar, You'll Discover:

  • Practical Migration Strategies: How Colgate identified, prioritized, and successfully transitioned their essential custom HR functionality to the cloud
  • Skills Transition Framework: How Colgate's ABAP developers adapted their existing skills to cloud development, accelerating adoption while reducing training costs
  • Design Principles: How implementing simple, reusable, and sustainable components created a future-proof HR landscape that's easier to maintain
  • Real-World Examples: See how Colgate preserved vital admin capabilities including:
    • Cloud-based payroll interface management (equivalent to PU12 in SAP HCM)
    • Organizational structure-based selection tools for custom processes

Key Takeaways:

  • Skill Reapplication: Discover how your on-premise ABAP resources can effectively transition to cloud development using SAP BTP
  • Enhanced User Experience: Learn how SAP BTP's Fiori Elements framework offers more robust solutions than your current on-premises environment
  • Strategic Advantage: Understand how designing with SAP standards while building reusable components reduces development effort, accelerates implementation, and simplifies support

Who Should Attend:
‚óè HRIT leaders owning the strategy for SAP SuccessFactors migration
‚óè HR Technology teams concerned about preserving critical custom functionality
‚óè SAP HCM developers looking to transfer their skills to the cloud environment
‚óè Business stakeholders wanting to ensure seamless HR operations during migration

This session builds upon our previous webinars with PepsiCo and on EC Integration, taking your SAP BTP knowledge to the next level with practical implementation insights.

Register now to learn how SAP BTP can turn your cloud migration into an opportunity to create an even better HR technology experience.

entry.title: Story Performance Analysis Tool in Report Center: New in 1H 2025!
entry.content:
Overview

The recent enhancements to the People Analytics module for the 1H 2025 have proven to be highly impactful. A particularly noteworthy enhancement is the ability to assess and optimize the efficiency of Story reports.

The Story Performance Analysis Tool, accessible via Report Center, enables Story administrators to assess, monitor, measure and optimize the efficiency of Story reports and captures detailed performance metrics, helping identify areas for improvement and enhance overall report performance. This enhancement aims to bring greater visibility and control over the performance aspects of Stories.

Benefits of Story Performance Analysis Tool: -

The Story Performance Analysis Tool delivers significant value to various user groups, including HR administrators, managers, and analytics power users:

  • For Administrators:

- Helps identify bottlenecks or inefficiencies in report design or data handling and minimizes report loading delays
- Allows for proactive performance tuning, such as optimizing filters, chart components, or data models.
- Reduces reliance on IT teams by giving admins tools to self-diagnose issues.

  •  For End Users (Managers, HRBPs, etc.):

- Ensures faster access to performance-critical reports and improves data-driven decision-making ensuring reports load reliably.
- Leads to a better user experience with less waiting time and smoother navigation.

  • Overall Organizational Benefits:

- Saves time and effort by eliminating guesswork around report performance issues.
- Helps maintain reporting integrity and reliability in strategic HR processes like performance management, compensation reviews.

What You‚Äôll Need:-

For successful utilization of this enhancement, make sure:

  • You have access to Stories in Report Center.
  • You have the Role-Based Permission Prerequisites: - Administrator > Manage Dashboards/Reports > Story Admin

Now let‚Äôs walk through the Procedure to utilize the Story Performance Analysis Tool: -

Step 1.  To access the Performance Analysis Tool, choose Story Performance Analysis Tool from the Report Center.

 

Landing Page of the Performance Analysis Tool:-

Step 2.  To set the date range:

  1. Click the Session Date token.
  2. Adjust the existing range or add a new range.

Step 3.  To apply additional filters:

  1. Click on User or Resource
  2. Select the appropriate member(s).

Step 4.  In the list of results, click to select the report/item to analyze.

 

The report is analyzed in 3 sections namely -

  • Summary
  • Details
  • History

a.) Summary Section

The Summary section provides a top-level overview of the total performance footprint of the Story report. It captures the end-to-end load time, determine where high-level delays are occurring and distributes it across the 3 primary system layers involved in report execution:

 Network ‚Äì Time spent in data transfer between the server and the client

 Backend ‚Äì Time taken to retrieve and prepare data from the data model

Frontend ‚Äì Time taken to render charts, tables, and visuals on the user interface.

- Under Summary section,

  • Startup Time displays ‚Äì The Timespan from the initiation of the Actions "Open" and "Go to Page to the finalized page.
  • Total Widget Time displays ‚Äì The sum of all usage times for each Widget, including multiple uses.
  • Maximum Backend Duration displays ‚Äì The maximum backend processing time per model, noting totals may rise with multiple widgets or refreshes. 
  • Maximum Widget Time and Total Widget Time displays ‚Äì Maximum and median processing times per layer (frontend, backend, network) across all widgets during user interactions

 

b.) Details Section

The Details section provides a granular breakdown of performance data, offering visibility into how specific report components contribute to overall load time. This includes: - Performance of individual pages within the Story, Load time of specific widgets, such as charts, graphs, or tables, Execution time for backend queries, including filtering, sorting, and data transformation

It is used by admins to troubleshoot performance bottlenecks and identifies exact sources of delay, facilitates targeted optimizations, reduces trial-and-error during report tuning.

- Under Details section,

  • Page Load Time displays ‚Äì Total load time per story page, split by phase, with peak backend, frontend, and network times
  • Widget Drilldown displays ‚Äì Widget load time with action, page, model, and backend request details.
  • Loading Sequence displays - Widget load time by action, split into backend, network, and frontend

 

c.) History Section

The History section records a time-stamped log of previous performance analyses conducted on the same Story report. It enables comparison of performance metrics across different test runs or after configuration changes.

It supports trend analysis and performance benchmarking over time and tracks performance improvements or regressions, provides historical evidence of tuning efforts, supports continuous monitoring for business-critical reports

Under History section,

  • Total Time per Date displays ‚Äì Charts compare a user's performance history with others, switching measures based on filters like page, action, or widget.
  • Runtime Split per Date displays ‚Äì Charts compare a single user‚Äôs runtime performance (median backend, network, frontend times) against all users, independent of filters.

 

Step 5.  Take Action Based on Insights: -

  1. Optimize charts and pages with high frontend time.
  2. Adjust or reduce filters and calculations affecting backend time.
  3. Collaborate with your technical team if network issues persist.

Administrators/Users also have the option ‚Äì

  • To enable the Show in Milliseconds toggle which will display the Time in milliseconds
  • To apply filters as per the requirement

You've reached the end of this process!

entry.title: Enable Social Login & 2FA for External Candidates in SAP SuccessFactors via SAP Customer Data Cloud
entry.content:
In Q4 2024, SAP SuccessFactors introduced a robust authentication mechanism for external candidates through SAP Customer Data Cloud (CDC). This enhancement delivers a fast, seamless, and secure login experience by enabling job seekers to login using email, phone number, or social credentials (such as Google or LinkedIn), while supporting two-factor authentication (2FA) for added security.

This blog provides a step-by-step guide to help you configure social login providers and 2FA for external candidates on your SAP SuccessFactors career site using the SAP CDC Console.

Overview of the Social Provider Integration Process

The integration involves three primary steps:

  1. Registering an Application with the social media provider

  2. Configuring the Identity Provider in SAP Customer Data Cloud

  3. Enabling the Social Login in the UI Builder of the SAP CDC Console

While steps 2 and 3 are consistent across providers, step 1 varies depending on the platform. Below are detailed instructions for Google and LinkedIn, followed by high-level guidelines for other providers.

A. Google Login Setup

Step 1: Register an application with Google

1.1 Access Google Cloud Console
Navigate to https://console.cloud.google.com and either create a new project or select an existing one.


1.2 Enable the Google People API

Go to API & Services > Library, search for Google People API, and click Enable. 

 

1.3 Create OAuth Credentials

Click Create Credentials and follow the next steps.


 

1.3.1 Credential Type

Under "What data will you be accessing", select the "User Data" radio button. 

1.3.2 Configure OAuth Consent Screen

Provide the following details :

  • App name (e.g., Candidate Login App)

  • App logo (mandatory; tools like Adobe Express can help)

  • Developer contact email

 

1.3.3 Scopes

This section is optional and can be skipped.

1.3.4 Configure OAuth Client ID

  • Application Type: Web Application

  • Name: A name for the credential (e.g., Google Login)

  • Authorized JavaScript origins: Use the base URL of your SAP SuccessFactors Career Site, such as:

    https://career68sales.successfactors.com

  • Authorized Redirect URIs:

    https://socialize.gigya.com/GS/GSLogin.aspx?  (Mandatory)
    https://socialize.<DataCenter>/GS/GSLogin.aspx? - 
    Replace the "DataCenter" field using the below link(e.g., https://socialize.us1.gigya.com/GS/GSLogin.aspx?)
    Ensure to include the trailing question mark (?) ‚Äî it is required for successful redirects. Refer to Finding your Data Center to find the details of your data center.

1.3.5 Download and Note Your Credentials

Once completed, you'll be shown the Client ID and Client Secret ‚Äî save these securely, as you'll need them in the next step when configuring CDC.

Step 2: Configure Google as an Identity Provider in SAP CDC

  1. Open the Identity Providers page of SAP Customer Data Cloud's Console.
  2. From the list of Identity Providers, select Google.
  3. Click on Google to open its configuration window.


  4. In the Google Configuration window enter:

    • Your "Client ID" from the Google Developers Dashboard into the "Consumer Key" field. (The entire string, including .apps.googleusercontent.com)
    • Your "Client Secret" into the "Secret Key" field.
    • Select Secure redirects only to allow only HTTPS redirects from Google.

Step 3: Enable Google Login in SAP CDC UI Builder

By default, the Login & Registration screen-set on the career site displays only basic authentication (email and password). To display the Social Login widget, follow these steps:

  1. Select a screen-set: Choose either the Registration or Login screen-set where you want to enable social login.

  2. In the Properties section:

    • Remove the gigya-hidden CSS class from the social widget (and also for the separator elements in the Login screen).

    • In the Supported Providers field, enter a comma-separated list of the social login providers to display ‚Äî for example: googleplus,linkedin,facebook

These changes will make the Google social provider visible to external candidates on the career site.

B. LinkedIn Login Setup

Step 1: Register an Application with LinkedIn

  1. Visit the LinkedIn Developer Portal.

  2. Create a new app and fill in the required details.



  3. Request access for sign in with linkedIn using openId connect



  4.  Navigate to the Auth tab and set the below Redirect URLs :

    4.1) The URL should be in the format "https://socialize.<DataCenter>/GS/GSLogin.aspx?" where  <DataCenter> can be found out using     Finding your Data Center.  Be sure to include the trailing question mark (?)  as it is required for successful redirects.

    4.2) The URL of your career site - for example, https://career68sales.successfactors.com



  5.  Under Settings -> Additional settings, add the above redirect URL's domain (ex. "https://socialize.us1.gigya.com")
    and that of your career site (ex. https://career68sales.successfactors.com)


  6. Save and note the Client ID and Client Secret, as these will be used in the next step.

Step 2: Configure LinkedIn as an Identity Provider in SAP CDC

  1. Open the Identity Providers page of SAP Customer Data Cloud's Console.

  2. Select LinkedIn from the list of supported providers.

  3. Paste your LinkedIn "API Key (Client ID)" and "Secret Key (Client Secret)" in the corresponding fields.

  4. Select Secure redirects only to allow only HTTPS redirects from Linkedin.
  5. Select Application Type as "Sign In with LinkedIn using OpenID Connect"
  6. Select the permission "Enable retrieving email address".

Step 3: Enable Linkedin Login in the SAP CDC UI Builder

By default, the Login & Registration screen-set on the career site displays only basic authentication (email and password). To display the Social Login widget, follow these steps:

  1. Select a screen-set: Choose either the Registration or Login screen-set where you want to enable social login.

  2. In the Properties section:

    • Remove the "gigya-hidden" CSS class from the social widget (and also for the separator elements in the Login screen).

    • In the Supported Providers field, enter a comma-separated list of the social login providers to display ‚Äî for example: googleplus,linkedin,facebook

These changes will make the Linkedin social provider visible to external candidates on the career site.

Extending to Other Social Login Providers

The process for integrating other social login providers, such as Facebook, Twitter, Apple, or GitHub, follows a similar pattern:‚Äã

  1. Register an application with the respective provider to obtain the necessary credentials.

  2. Configure the provider in the SAP CDC Console by entering the required credentials from the application.

  3. Enable the provider in the SAP CDC Console's UI Builder to make it available as a login option.‚Äã

For detailed guidance on integrating additional providers, refer to the SAP Customer Data Cloud documentation.‚Äã

Enabling Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) in SAP Customer Data Cloud

Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) enhances login security by requiring users to verify their identity through a second method, such as email, SMS, or an authenticator app. SAP Customer Data Cloud supports all three options.

Follow the steps below to enable 2FA for external candidates in SAP SuccessFactors using SAP CDC:

Step 1: Enable Email Identity Verification (Required for Email 2FA)

Before enabling email-based 2FA, ensure email identity verification is active:

  1. Navigate to Identity ‚Üí Security in the CDC Console.

  2. Open the Identity Verification tab.

  3. In the Email Verification section:

    • Select Require email verification.

    • Enable Use code verification to require users to enter a code from the verification email.

  4. Click Save.

Step 2: Enable 2FA Authentication Methods

Go to Identity ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Authentication and, under Verification Methods, enable your preferred 2FA options:

  • Email ‚Äì Check Email and click Save.

    Requires email verification to be enabled (see Step 1).

  • SMS/Phone ‚Äì Check SMS/Phone and click Save.

    Ensure an SMS provider is configured.

  • Authenticator App ‚Äì Check Authenticator App, enter a name (e.g., SAP Login Authenticator), and click Save.

    Users need an app like Google or Microsoft Authenticator installed.

Step 3: Create a Risk-Based Authentication (RBA) Rule

To apply the 2FA methods during login, set up a Risk-Based Authentication rule:

  1. Open the Risk Based Authentication tab under Identity-> Security in the CDC Console.

  2. Click on Create New Rule, select the template "Enforce TFA for Every Login" and click Next

  3. Provide a rule name and select "Password Login" as the trigger condition.


  4. Under Rule type, select "Global Rule" and define the required criteria below.

  5. In the Actions section, select the 2FA method(s) to enforce (Email, SMS, Authenticator App).

  6. Click Next and set the Scope to apply to the whole group.

  7. Save the Rule.

Once configured, candidates logging in with their credentials will be prompted for an additional verification step, depending on the methods you‚Äôve enabled.

Additional References

For a high-level overview, prerequisites, and benefits of using SAP Customer Data Cloud, refer to the blog.

For detailed information on migrating and enabling SAP CDC for Success Factors Candidate Authentication, refer to the blog.

entry.title: Maintenance Timelines for SAP ERP HCM: What You Need to Know
entry.content:
This blog aims to inform you about the SAP ERP 6.0 maintenance timelines which SAP announced in 2020 and how they apply to your SAP ERP HCM (Human Capital Management) solution. We'll guide you through identifying your release and enhancement package level and outline your options to remain within maintenance.

When Will Maintenance for SAP ERP HCM End?

As outlined in the SAP Release and Maintenance Strategy (login required) and detailed in SAP Note 2881788 (login required) and the Product Availability Matrix (PAM), mainstream maintenance for the latest three enhancement packages for SAP ERP 6.0 ‚Äì specifically enhancement packages 6, 7, and 8 ‚Äì runs until December 31, 2027. This is followed by an optional extended maintenance phase lasting until December 31, 2030, which carries an additional cost.

However, it is crucial to note that mainstream maintenance for SAP ERP HCM 6.0 without any enhancement package, as well as SAP ERP HCM 6.0 with enhancement packages 1 to 5, will conclude on December 31, 2025.

How to Find Your Release and Enhancement Package Level

To determine your system's release and enhancement package level, follow these steps:

1. Log on to your system and open the system status:

This can typically be accessed from the main menu or administration settings.

2. Open the product version details:

Look for detailed information about the installed software versions.

3. Locate the entry for SAP_HR and note the release number next to it:

For any SAP ERP 6.0 system, the first digit will be 6. The second digit is not relevant for this check, and the third digit indicates your enhancement package level. For instance, 604 means the system is on SAP ERP 6.0 with enhancement package 4.

What Are Your Options to Stay in Maintenance?

It is important to start planning now, especially if you are using a system with maintenance ending in 2025, as transition projects can take months or even years.

SAP S/4HANA: With SAP's maintenance commitment extending until 2040 and over 20,000 customers already on board, SAP S/4HANA is the natural destination for a short-term technical transition. Many organizations also opt to move to the cloud, choosing RISE with SAP. Reach out to your SAP account executive or SAP partner to explore your options, including opportunities to modernize and transform to SAP SuccessFactors.

SAP Readiness Check: Before making any moves, we strongly recommend starting with the SAP Readiness Check. These tools are included with your maintenance agreement at no extra cost, providing a comprehensive overview of the most important aspects for a transition to SAP S/4HANA. While primarily designed for customers considering a system conversion (a technical transition of an entire SAP ERP system to SAP S/4HANA), SAP Readiness Checks also offer valuable insights for those planning a new implementation.  There are two Readiness Check variants that will support HCM transition. 

First is the SAP Readiness Check for S/4HANA Conversion.  This Readiness Check will provide you with insight into the Simplification Items required for HCM.  Additionally, the SAP Readiness Check for SAP SuccessFactors will provide more extensive insight into which components of the HCM solution are deployed, to what extent it has been customized, and a summary of integrations.  If you are running S/4HANA and HCM in the same landscape, these two Readiness Checks can be run together, for a consolidated view. 

Call to Action

Don‚Äôt miss out on these critical steps to ensure your system remains supported:

  1. Review your system to determine product release and associated end of maintenance date per the process outlined above.
  2. Run the SAP Readiness Checks to understand the scope and requirements for your transition.
  3. Explore the HCM EvoKit by registering on the appropriate page.
  4. Share your thoughts and feedback in the comments section below.

By acting now, you can ensure a smooth transition and continued support for your SAP ERP HCM solution.

entry.title: SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
Why this matters: the upcoming changes turn what looked like a technical switch into a strategic decision that can affect your budget, compliance posture, and HCM roadmap. Activations of Business Function for SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA directly influence whether you need additional HCM licenses, which capabilities you can keep on-premise versus in Private Cloud, and how quickly you should plan a move to SuccessFactors for certain functions. Getting ahead of this now helps you avoid unplanned costs or audit exposure, prevents disruption to HR processes tied to payroll, time, and regulatory reporting, and gives you time to align contracts, license product codes, and project timelines. The guidance below distills what‚Äôs changing and the practical steps to stay compliant while keeping your transformation on track.

Starting with SAP S/4HANA 2025, the Business Function for SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA‚ÄØ will be turned on by default. From this release on, there is no compatibility pack for HCM anymore. ‚ÄØThis technical change is not reversible. The licensing requirements are applicable when SAP HCM is utilized beyond the scope of the HR Mini Master, in cases where the customer is conducting HCM processes in the system.

For the technical details, please check the KBA 3443536 - SAP S/4HANA Release 2025 will be delivered with active H4S4_1 Business Function - SAP for Me 

Some functionality is not available in S/4HANA Private Cloud; e.g. SAP Learning Solution is available in S/4HANA on-premise, when moving to Private Cloud, the go-to solution is SuccessFactors Learning.

You can see the details of what features are enabled and what are disabled you can check in the following note 3091160 - SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì General Approach and Strategy - SAP for Me 

A customer using the HCM compatibility pack today in SAP S/4HANA on-premise can receive a prolongation only if they move to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition, via a lift-and-shift (like-for-like) migration that preserves the current release. If the move includes an upgrade to the 2025 release, the H4S4_1 business function will be active by default, and the HCM compatibility pack will no longer be available, so prolongation does not apply.  With the requested change, they would get the prolongation as well in case they directly move to SuccessFactors, which is our strategic intent.

HCM License Materials and Usage Rights 

 

Customers must also license SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA latest the first day after the expiry of the Compatibility Package.

Please contact your account executive to plan the license conversion as soon as possible.

If you have any questions, just drop them in the Q&A section with the tags SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. We'll try to get back to you as soon as we can.
